text: godmother of punk rock poet s National
Book Award winner Patti Smith has played
multiple roles since her seminal album
horses was released 40 years ago this
year she crossed a new frontier with her
lullaby mercy is which plays a key role
in darren aronofsky's noah a film about
the Biblical Flood playing Noah Russell
Crowe swings the lullaby to an orphan
who as an adult sings it to her own
children home mercy is has also earned
Miss Smith her first nomination for a
Golden Globe how did it come about did
you know darren aronofsky bumped into
him in Venice I know it sounds so
pretentious I met him on the streets of
Venice during the Venice Film Festival
and I asked him what he was working on
and he told me about his vision of Noah
I was so excited because I like biblical
based film where the possibilities of a
biblical base film i aggressively
volunteered
me
it's interesting how this is it's a
softer song you're called the godmother
of punk it's not my fault it's a simple
little song but sometimes the simple
things are the hardest things to write
did you say went back to the Old
Testament yeah of course I mean I I mean
that the Noah's story in the Old
Testament is so small but I studied the
Bible quite a bit as a child I mean as a
young girl I was raised to have a
witness and I like reading the Bible
there's a lot of poetry in the Bible
with Noah itself the movie it's so
bittersweet because we know what happens
humans went forth and multiplied despite
the flood and there's that sort of
sadness to it as well well there's also
sadness that we make the same mistakes
over and over again once again there's
murder and treachery doubt and sorrow
I know we live in troubled times we're
all navigating our arc through these
terrible storms but I'm one of those
people that believe that rainbow is
right around the corner
